channel.title: 纽约时报-全球
channel.description: 这是一个追踪纽约时报-全球news的种子

item.title: 俄罗斯最高安全机构负责人在没有提供证据的情况下说，这次袭击是 "西方特勤部门协助的"。乌克兰否认参与其中，称这些说法是 "谎言"。
item.description:
The head of Russia’s top security agency said, without providing evidence, that the assault was “facilitated by Western special services.” Ukraine has denied involvement, calling the assertions “lies.” https://t.co/V141EirnKQ

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 26, 2024

item.title: 中村绫的音乐是法国最重要的文化输出之一。但有关她可能在巴黎奥运会开幕式上表演的报道引发了有关身份和语言的激烈争论。
item.description:
Aya Nakamura’s music is one of France’s top cultural exports. But reports she might perform at the Paris Games opening ceremony have sparked fierce debates over identity and language. https://t.co/lhzecm7X6b

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 26, 2024

item.title: 随着移民问题成为美国总统竞选的焦点，墨西哥已成为对美国政坛最大问题之一具有超强影响力的关键角色，并有可能左右选举结果。
item.description:
As immigration moves to the forefront of the U.S. presidential campaign, Mexico has emerged as a key player with outsize influence over one of the biggest issues in American politics — with the potential to sway the outcome of the election. https://t.co/PJ9Z5cMrhi

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 26, 2024

item.title: 在我们报道了博尔索纳罗显然在匈牙利大使馆寻求庇护之后，他在巴西面临着新的法律危险。
item.description:
Bolsonaro faces new legal jeopardy in Brazil following our reporting on his apparent bid for asylum at the Hungarian Embassy.

Brazil's federal police are investigating and the Supreme Court gave him 48 hours to explain.

w/ @leocoelho_jor & @opaulommhttps://t.co/zsUKkIMUGd

— Jack Nicas (@jacknicas) March 26, 2024

item.title: 据说在《纽约时报》报道前总统雅伊尔-博尔索纳罗在匈牙利大使馆待了两天之后，巴西最高法院和联邦警察已经开始调查。
item.description:
Brazil’s Supreme Court and the country’s federal police are said to have begun investigations after The New York Times reported that former President Jair Bolsonaro had spent two days in the Hungarian Embassy. https://t.co/ZOpyt7fLGu

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 26, 2024

item.title: 周二，一名自杀式炸弹袭击者在巴基斯坦北部驾车撞向中国工人的车队，造成至少五名中国工人丧生。他们的巴基斯坦司机也在袭击中丧生。
item.description:
At least five Chinese workers were killed on Tuesday when a suicide bomber rammed a vehicle into their convoy in northern Pakistan, officials said. Their Pakistani driver was also killed in the attack. https://t.co/ufJTKDOPhp

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 26, 2024

item.title: 即时新闻：英国法院表示，在决定是否将朱利安-阿桑奇引渡到美国之前，法院需要更多关于朱利安-阿桑奇在美国将受到何种待遇的保证。
item.description:
Breaking News: A British court said it needed more assurances about how Julian Assange would be treated in the U.S. before deciding whether he would be extradited there. https://t.co/HyZe3TGTx6

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 26, 2024

item.title: 四名男子被指控对莫斯科附近的一个音乐厅实施了袭击，他们遭受酷刑的视频广为流传，分析人士认为，这表明俄罗斯国家对公共暴力的容忍度在不断提高。
item.description:
Videos showing the torture of four men accused of carrying out an attack on a concert hall near Moscow have circulated widely in what analysts say is a sign of the Russian state’s growing tolerance for public violence. https://t.co/u4s4HjpQHg

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 26, 2024

item.title: 随着欧盟加大应对气候变化的力度，它需要使占全球温室气体排放量四分之一的货运去碳化。为了实现这一目标，欧盟正在寻求一种具有百年历史的解决方案：河流。
item.description:
As the European Union steps up its battle against climate change, it needs to decarbonize freight transport, responsible for a quarter of global greenhouse gas emissions. To get there, it is turning back to a centuries-old solution: its rivers. https://t.co/WHcGdMTQPP

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 26, 2024

item.title: 两名英国法官将决定维基解密创始人朱利安-阿桑奇（Julian Assange）是否有权就引渡令向美国提出上诉。以下是相关信息。
item.description:
Two British judges are set to decide whether Julian Assange, the WikiLeaks founder, will be granted the right to appeal an extradition order to the United States, where he is facing charges under the Espionage Act.

Here’s what to know. https://t.co/FgfZFkG68g

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 26, 2024

item.title: 周日，巴黎恢复了一项传统：一年一度的咖啡馆和餐馆服务员竞赛。参赛者端着装满羊角面包的托盘在街上奔跑，这是法国首都在夏季奥运会之前展示其咖啡馆文化的时刻。
item.description:
On Sunday, Paris revived a tradition: an annual race of cafe and restaurant waiters.

Contestants rushed through the streets with croissant-laden trays in a moment for the French capital to showcase its cafe culture ahead of the Summer Olympics. https://t.co/oNu0aTGwhA

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 25, 2024

item.title: 据《纽约时报》分析，当四名男子因与莫斯科郊外音乐厅的大屠杀有关而被俄罗斯拘留时，他们的穿着与袭击视频中的袭击者如出一辙。
item.description:
When four men were detained by Russia in connection with the massacre at a concert hall outside Moscow, they were dressed in the same attire as the assailants seen in videos of the attack, according to a New York Times analysis. https://t.co/tFSVI0Q3wk

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 25, 2024

item.title: 视频：博尔索纳罗藏身匈牙利大使馆：独家监控录像显示，巴西前总统在狂欢节期间在匈牙利大使馆住了两个晚上：
item.description:
Vídeo: Bolsonaro se escondeu na Embaixada da Hungria.

Imagens exclusivas das câmeras de segurança revelam que ex-presidente do Brasil passou duas noites hospedado na Embaixada da Hungria durante o Carnaval.

Veja a matéria completa e os vídeos aqui: https://t.co/Co1fTuAvdV pic.twitter.com/DC7t6bRmOg

— Jack Nicas (@jacknicas) March 25, 2024

item.title: 泰晤士报》获得的监控录像显示，巴西前总统雅伊尔-博尔索纳罗在匈牙利大使馆度过了两个夜晚，显然是在寻求庇护。
item.description:
Security-camera footage obtained by The Times shows that Jair Bolsonaro, Brazil’s former president, spent two nights at the Hungarian Embassy in an apparent bid for asylum. https://t.co/jOv9bev1aq

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 25, 2024

item.title: 预计英国政府将公开把中国与泄露数千万人投票记录的网络攻击联系起来，这是伦敦对中国政府立场的又一次明显强硬。
item.description:
The British government is expected to publicly link China to cyberattacks that compromised the voting records of tens of millions of people, another notable hardening of London’s stance toward Beijing. https://t.co/a7xPInI2yo

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 25, 2024

item.title: 即时新闻：联合国安理会通过了加沙停火决议，打破了美国否决数项结束战争呼吁后的僵局。
item.description:
Breaking News: The U.N. Security Council passed a resolution for a cease-fire in Gaza, breaking an impasse after the U.S. vetoed several calls to end the war. https://t.co/ACGccXyECx

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 25, 2024

item.title: 爆炸性新闻：巴西鲁-迪奥马耶-法耶（Bassirou Diomaye Faye）是一位年轻的政治局外人，他得到了一位强大的反对派人士的支持，在塞内加尔总统选举中出人意料地大获全胜。
item.description:
Breaking News: Bassirou Diomaye Faye, a young political outsider backed by a powerful opposition figure, has won a surprise outright victory in Senegal’s presidential election only 10 days after being released from jail. https://t.co/SkWdlCbnAO

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 25, 2024

item.title: 俄罗斯国家媒体试图反驳美国关于莫斯科附近音乐厅发生的致命袭击是 "伊斯兰国 "分支所为的说法，转而指责乌克兰。
item.description:
Russian state media was trying to counter U.S. assessments that the deadly attack on a concert hall near Moscow was the work of an offshoot of the Islamic State, blaming Ukraine instead. https://t.co/t275KvRLRV

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 25, 2024

item.title: 在采访中，莫斯科郊区克罗库斯市政厅袭击事件的幸存者描述了一个典型的周五夜晚如何演变成惊慌和恐怖的场面。一位与会者说："你只是在跑，想知道还能跑到哪里去。
item.description:
In interviews, survivors of the attack at Crocus City Hall on Moscow’s outskirts described how what started as a typical Friday night out devolved into a scene of panic and terror.

“You’re just running to figure out where else to run,” one attendee said. https://t.co/3CJxIgC8xV

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 25, 2024

item.title: 加沙已成为一个 140 平方英里的墓地，每一座被摧毁的建筑都是一座嶙峋的坟墓，埋葬着那些仍被埋葬的人。被埋葬的人构成了死亡人数的阴影，成为加沙卫生部官方统计数字中的铅色星号。
item.description:
Gaza has become a 140-square-mile graveyard, each destroyed building another jagged tomb for those still buried within.

The buried make up a shadow death toll, a leaden asterisk to the Gazan health ministry’s official tally. https://t.co/OxuFyk2Xcn

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 25, 2024

item.title: 周日，四名涉嫌上周对莫斯科附近一座音乐厅发动致命袭击的男子在地方法院接受传讯，并被指控犯有恐怖行为罪。
item.description:
Four men suspected of carrying out a deadly attack on a concert hall near Moscow last week were arraigned in a district court on Sunday and charged with committing a terrorist act. https://t.co/gkbv2JY54S

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 25, 2024

item.title: 多年来，苹果一直主导着中国高端智能手机市场。但越来越多的证据表明，对许多中国人来说，iPhone 已不再具有以往的吸引力。
item.description:
For years, Apple dominated the market for high-end smartphones in China. But evidence is mounting that, for many in China, the iPhone no longer holds the appeal it used to. https://t.co/WqMe5NiSNr

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 25, 2024

item.title: 争夺乌克兰东部阿夫杰夫卡掩体的战斗只是600英里战线上数十场冲突中的一小部分。但它凸显了在一场越来越多地以血腥、近距离作战方式进行的战争中，防守和进攻是多么困难。
item.description:
The battle for the bunker in Avdiivka, in eastern Ukraine, was only a small part of one of dozens of clashes raging along a 600-mile front. But it highlights how hard it is to defend and attack in a war increasingly fought in bloody, close-quarter combat. https://t.co/Cxek77E61D

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 24, 2024

item.title: 由于国王查尔斯三世和威尔士王妃凯瑟琳正在接受癌症治疗，卡米拉爽朗、不苟言笑的风格帮助这个失去平衡的家庭稳定下来。
item.description:
Camilla’s brisk, no-nonsense style has helped steady a family thrown badly off balance as King Charles III and Catherine, Princess of Wales, are treated for cancer. https://t.co/IyQfldp2BZ

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 24, 2024

item.title: 教皇方济各选择在复活节周一开始时跳过这场艰苦的演讲，立即引起了人们对他健康状况的担忧，但他在演讲前后的讲话声音清晰。
item.description:
Pope Francis’ choice to skip the strenuous speech at the outset of Easter week immediately raised concerns about his health, but he spoke in a clear voice before and after it. https://t.co/LgHyyZ6KQH

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 24, 2024

item.title: 印度马哈拉施特拉邦砍甘蔗的妇女正在接受不必要的子宫切除手术，通常是为了继续工作，不受月经、怀孕或妇科检查的干扰。
item.description:
Women who cut sugar cane in the Indian state of Maharashtra are getting unnecessary hysterectomies, often as a way to keep working, undistracted by periods, pregnancies or gynecological checkups. https://t.co/dHdG2Brk8N

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 24, 2024

item.title: 尼日利亚官员周日表示，本月早些时候被绑架的数十名尼日利亚学童已经获释。
item.description:
Dozens of Nigerian schoolchildren who were kidnapped earlier this month have been freed, officials said on Sunday. https://t.co/fJsiOnrMcx

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 24, 2024

item.title: 塞内加尔周日投票选举新总统，许多年轻人认为这是一次彻底改革政治和经济秩序的机会。这次选举可谓一波三折，令人目不暇接。
item.description:
Senegal votes for a new president Sunday, in an election that many young people see as a chance to overhaul the political and economic order. And it has been a nail-biting and whiplash-inducing run-up. https://t.co/O2ywN0Dj8Y

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 24, 2024

item.title: 曾在里约市议会任职的两兄弟因被指控下令谋杀政治新星玛丽埃尔-佛朗哥（Marielle Franco）而被捕，他们的目的是要让玛丽埃尔-佛朗哥在反腐斗争中保持沉默。
item.description:
Two brothers who once served on Rio’s City Council have been arrested on accusations that they ordered the murder of Marielle Franco, a rising political star, to silence her battles against corruption. https://t.co/tIp84FUZFF

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 24, 2024

item.title: 周日，在俄罗斯悼念二十多年来莫斯科地区最严重恐怖袭击事件遇难者的同时，关于此次袭击的不同说法也在国内传播并占据主导地位。
item.description:
As Russia mourned the victims of the worst terrorist attack in the Moscow area in more than two decades on Sunday, differing narratives about the attack were spreading and taking hold in the country. https://t.co/GkxpRFXsoG

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 24, 2024
